H0.text: The brain is the organ that increased in size during evolution in humans relative to that of the chimpanzee.

H1.text: Stomach is the organ whose size increased in humans relative to that of the chimpanzee during evolution.

H2.text: The lung is the organ that increased in size in humans relative to that of the chimpanzee during evolution.

H3.text: The liver is the organ that increased in size in humans relative to chimpanzees during evolution.

A4.text: The human brain is almost twice as large as that of a bottlenose dolphin, and three times as large as that of a chimpanzee.

A5.text: The sequence of human evolution from Australopithecus (four million years ago) to Homo sapiens (modern humans) was marked by a steady increase in brain size.
